comments:
Try to import the attached log file, it will consistenly fail at record 30900. 
Even if the file is transformed into CBE using the standalone GLA and then the 
resulted XML file is imported in the workbench the same InvalidXMLException 
occurrs.
The import doesn't fail though with the 20051014 build.

I suspect you get the following exception, to make it work use
-DentityExpansionLimit=500000 VMARGS argument, for explanations please see  
http://www.macromedia.com/support/coldfusion/ts/documents/xml_entity_limit.htm:

org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Parser has reached the entity expansion limit
"64,000" set by the Application.
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.fatal(Parser2.java:3376)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.fatal(Parser2.java:3370)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.expandEntityInLiteral(Parser2.java:969)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parseLiteral(Parser2.java:900)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.maybeElement(Parser2.java:1583)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.content(Parser2.java:1963)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.maybeElement(Parser2.java:1691)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parseInternal(Parser2.java:667)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parse(Parser2.java:337)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.XMLReaderImpl.parse(XMLReaderImpl.java:448)
	at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(SAXParser.java:345)
	at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(SAXParser.java:143)
	at
org.eclipse.hyades.models.hierarchy.util.internal.CrimsonFragmentHandler.parse(CrimsonFragmentHandler.java:155)
	at
org.eclipse.hyades.models.hierarchy.util.internal.CrimsonFragmentHandler.scanContent(CrimsonFragmentHandler.java:672)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.loaders.util.XMLLoader.loadEvents(XMLLoader.java:731)
	at
org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.wizard.ImportTracePage1$3.run(ImportTracePage1.java:884)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)


This log can be imported if Xerces is used (IBM JRE), seems that when there is
no security manager used with Xerces the error is not triggered (because the
entityExpansionLimit is not checked, anyway even when a security manager is used
because the default entityExpansionLimit in Xerces is 100000 you should be able
to import 48276 events from the attached log versus 30900 events with Crimson.

The question why this is happening still remains, seems that a lot of characters
are encoded in the resulting set of CommonBaseEvents, we could probably tweak
the GLA parser(s) to trim the quotes from the msg attribute, they don't add any
value any way.

We should add a note in the Import Log wizard help and mention the workaround.

True, it fails only when running with the SUN jdk, but I'm afraid most of the 
TPTP users will use SUN to run LTA.

traces.message: Parser has reached the entity expansion limit "64,000" set by the Application.
